Title: Randomised Controlled Trial on Varicose Vein Management Guidelines

Background: Varicose veins affect millions worldwide, causing discomfort and complications. This study aimed to update clinical practice guidelines for managing varicose veins.

Methods: A multisociety and multispecialty writing group conducted a systematic review and meta-analysis to develop evidence-based guidelines. The study included a comprehensive literature review up to January 31, 2023, using databases such as Ovid MEDLINE and Cochrane Library. The guidelines were graded using the GRADE method.

Participants: The study focused on patients with lower extremity varicose veins (CEAP Class C2 disease).

Intervention: The guidelines addressed prevention and management strategies, including compression, medications, and nutritional supplements, as well as treatment of varicose tributaries and management of complications.

Objective: To provide updated, evidence-based guidelines for the management of varicose veins.

Outcome: The primary outcome was the development of comprehensive guidelines for varicose vein management, measured over the study period.

Randomisation: Not applicable.

Blinding: Not applicable.

Number randomised: Not applicable.

Number analysed: Not applicable.

Results: The guidelines provided strong and weak recommendations, ungraded consensus statements, and good practice statements. The recommendations were based on systematic reviews and expert consensus.

Harm: Not applicable.

Interpretation: The updated guidelines offer a comprehensive approach to managing varicose veins, aiding practitioners in delivering evidence-based care.

Trial registration: Not applicable.

Funding: Not specified.
